Class ManagerService

java.lang.Object
services.ManagerService
public class ManagerService extends Object
ManagerService (schema-aligned) ------------------------------- Read-only queries for the Statistics page, aligned with your current DB: "Order" : id, date (timestamp), price (numeric), employeeId (int), customerId (int) "Employee" : id, isManager (bool) "Customer" : id, email (text), points (int) "MenuItem" : id, name (text), price (numeric) "OrderItem" : id, menuItemId, orderId, ... Notes: - There is NO cashier name or payment type column in this schema. * Cashier is shown as "Emp <employeeId>" for readability. * Payment filter is effectively a no-op (list remains empty; controller prefixes "All Payments"). - Total = "Order".price; Subtotal/Tax are 0.0 (not tracked).

  • Method Details

    • getCashiers

      public List<String> getCashiers() throws SQLException
      Returns distinct cashier labels derived from the employeeId column in the "Order" table. The label format is Emp N, where N is the employee ID.
      Returns:
      a list of distinct cashier labels in ascending order
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • getPaymentTypes

      public List<String> getPaymentTypes()
      Returns the distinct payment types. Note: the current schema does not store payment type; this method returns an empty list.
      Returns:
      an empty list, since payment types are not tracked in the schema

    • getOrdersBetween

      public List<ManagerService.OrderDTO> getOrdersBetween(LocalDate from, LocalDate to, String cashier, String paymentIgnored, String search) throws SQLException
      Retrieves orders for the statistics screen within an optional date window and optional filters. Filters that are null, blank, or equal to an "All …" sentinel are ignored. The payment filter is ignored because the schema does not contain a payment column.
      Parameters:
      from - inclusive start date; ignored if null
      to - inclusive end date; ignored if null
      cashier - label in the format "Emp N"; ignored if null or equals "All Cashiers"
      paymentIgnored - placeholder for a payment filter; ignored due to schema constraints
      search - case-insensitive search across order id, customer email, and menu item name; ignored if blank
      Returns:
      a list of ManagerService.OrderDTO records in reverse chronological order
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • getDailySales

      public LinkedHashMap<LocalDate, Double> getDailySales(LocalDate from, LocalDate to) throws SQLException
      Returns a mapping of date to total sales (inclusive) for the specified window.
      Parameters:
      from - inclusive start date
      to - inclusive end date
      Returns:
      an insertion-ordered map from LocalDate to total sales amount
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • getTopItems

      public LinkedHashMap<String,Integer> getTopItems(LocalDate from, LocalDate to, int limit) throws SQLException
      Returns the top-N menu items by count for the specified date range. Since there is no quantity column, results are computed via COUNT(*) of order items.
      Parameters:
      from - inclusive start date
      to - inclusive end date
      limit - maximum number of items to return
      Returns:
      an insertion-ordered map from item name to count, sorted descending by count
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs
